result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Louis Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, assessments, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

*NO firearms.
*NO possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

*NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Anger Management and continued programming.
*Complete a parenting class.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

***12-11-15/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner****
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation. 
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 5 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Louis Ford

defendant.name: Ford, Johnny Louis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's motion or request for release privileges/additional release privileges is DENIED by the Court. The Court intended the Defendant to serve the sentence without release privileges if probation was revoked. Order received, signed, and filed with the court.
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges.
Reflects 12-11-15 Court order imposing 5 days of condition time

Defendant Johnny Louis Ford in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 5 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction consecutive to the sentence ordered in Count 2.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months, to run concurrent to the probation order in Count 2.

As to Count 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction consecutive to the sentence ordered in Count 1.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months, to run concurrent to the probation order in Count 1.



CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 25 days in the House of Correction on Count 1 and 30 days in the House of Correction on Count 2.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/11/2015.
-Anger Management and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, assessments, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.

Defendant Johnny Louis Ford in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to negotiations and on oral motion othe State, the Court ordered Count 2 amended to Resiting an Officer, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.41(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.

As to Count 1 and as to Count 2 as amended:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Court modified the no contact order, that the defendant may have no violent contact with the victim and children outside of the home.  Court ordered Justice Point Supervision as a condition of bond.   mld

No possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription.  No firearms / dangerous weapons and defendant may not be in the home at 4635 W Leon Terrace Milwaukee, WI.   mld

Defendant Johnny Louis Ford in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim, Tonila J. appeared to request modification of the no contact order.  Court modified the no contact order, that the defendant may have no violent contact with the victim and children outside of the home.  Court ordered Justice Point Supervision as a condition of bond.   mld

Defendant Johnny Louis Ford in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer will be forthcoming, per the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-2-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.    The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tonila J.

Defendant Johnny Louis Ford in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  As to count 1, defendant plead not guilty.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
